links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Nick Hobson, Python program for this sequence
prog: (PARI) isper(v,startAt=1)=for(k=startAt,#v-3, for(i=1,3,if(v[i]!=v[k+i],next(2)));return(k)); 0ap(p)=my(v=vector(99),t); v[1]=v[2]=v[3]=1; for(i=4,#v,v[i]=sum(j=i-3,i-1,v[j])%p); while((t=isper(v,if(#v>99,#v/2-2,1)))==0, v=concat(v, vector(#v)); for(i=#v/2+1,#v, v[i]=sum(j=i-3,i-1,v[j])%p));tape(p,e)=if(p==2, return(if(e>1,p^e,1))); if(e==1, return(ap(p))); my(pe=p^e, P=ap(p)*p^(e-1), v=vector(P+3)); v[1]=v[2]=v[3]=1; for(i=4,#v,v[i]=sum(j=i-3,i-1,v[j])%pe); isper(v)a(n)=my(f=factor(n)); lcm(vector(#f~, i, ape(f[i,1],f[i,2]))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 10 2015
author: _David W. Wilson_
